reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does not self distruct after a few months!
reviews.reviewText: I like a braided belt, but the design puts stress on the weave and a faux leather cannot hold up and will fall apart. This belt has held up and become a daily wear. Quality is good, size is correct, and durability gives a good value. I would recommend and buy again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very well made. Very durable. Finish is great nicely done. True to size. Great value. Extremely pleased. Thanks, LC

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars As described mostly; first reactions
reviews.reviewText: Boy were the reviews I read.... "interesting!". Lots of contradicting tails of woe, mostly about sizing, material & smell.Well... my goal was to replace a somewhat fancy (actual) black braided-leather belt after maybe 15 years of occasional use. Just started tearing, a few of the individual slats, old age. So basically I wanted at least somewhat stylish belt for black pants, casual and more bizzy. So....Material/Appearance: First reaction was "stiff?!" - Unrolling it the belt felt rather stiff, but it's new, so...The appearance is nice with the "leather" over buckle mid-bar, though the buckle itself is big & casual, as the belt is on the wider side too. Works with both jeans and black chinos fine. Probably not super-formal.Now the thing is, this belt is not "braided leather". Not sure about the leather, but before that I must say (though none of the other comments I read mentioned it; "maybe it's just me?") - there are rows of holes lined up with "braid simulation" giving the illusion (at a distance) of it being a braided belt. It's not. But hopefully people are not going to have their faces that close to it, if worried about the other big review comment: the smell. At first I didn't smell a thing and was curious. I have a good sense of smell, and when I held it up and inhaled, wow! High-powered aroma, and very much the essence of how it smells in my tiny neighborhood leather/shoe repair shoppe. Real or sprayed smell? Can't say. And so far can't understand (in my scientist hat) why the "leather" looks lacquered or varnished, and so stiff and so smelly (up close, that is; really not that noticeable except an inch away). Fun reviews....So the big question is value... Some say it's going to peel apart in minutes or weeks. "We'll see". I'll be wearing this with heavy jeans, and other belts with lighter or browner pants. I'll know in weeks to months, maybe, if it peels apart or is just a bit "unique" in its fabrication. (It does *say* leather, but if it's all in a top lacquered layer over "other" material, can't say. Time will tell. Meanwhile I got the slightly larger size (38+) despite that being on the large size, because I'd rather have extra room than being squeezed. Turns out there were 3-4 inches beyond the buckle and that worked out perfectly for loops, so the sizing was right, the smell was leather, and I'm hoping this will keep my jeans up!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! A favorite
reviews.reviewText: The belt is beautifully made and it's real leather. It looks really expensive and immediately became a favorite -- and I have a lot of belts. However, I believe the size runs a bit large. I chose a 36" belt for a 34" waist and could possibly have gone a size smaller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Belt! Worth the price
reviews.reviewText: The belt is great. Looks nice and wears well!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Belt fit as expected. I ordered next size as I have a generous stomach but jeans/belt ride on hips just right.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've been wearing these for several years now. They are extremely comfortable; much more supple than a solid leather belt. And they look good in all color variations too.As with all braided belts, the lacing may eventually break in a high-wear spot (like at a belt loop), but I typically get about 3-4 years out of one before that happens. And that is perfectly acceptable to me as a trade-off for being so pleasant to wear.First time I bought one of these I wasn't sure I liked the leather cover on the buckle and thought about cutting off. I never did because it turned out to be a very nice touch that keeps the clasp from rattling and makes the belt slide through just that much easier when putting it on.I also like the expending sizes available. I prefer some excess "tail" in order to tuck the tongue not only into the keeper on the belt, but also into the next belt loop of my pants. So and oversized belt is a must for me, though not that easy to find when you're already venturing into "big & tall" sizing.All in all, highly recommended. Nice looking. Comfortable. And a very good value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Get one size bigger than you think you need
reviews.reviewText: GREAT product but if I did it again I would get one size bigger. Looks good and easy to wear without feeling stiff.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far so good. I find it very comfortable.
reviews.reviewText: It did take a while to get here but it did arrive far earlier than I was told initially. Only one draw back that is not critical is that there are 3 hole along the width of the belt strap and a few times I have put the prong into one of the other holes instead of the correct center hole. You will have to pay attention by looking or by feel to get the right hole for the prong. Other than that, it is a great belt and those extra holes look good as part of the design.
